website_summaries.verdict: A pillow made for resting your neck in the car, and can be twisted to provide support at just the right angle.
pros: The bend-ability of this pillow makes it very comfortable
Cotton cover is easy to clean
Bendable cord inside memory foam pillow stays in position well
Soft and squishy, but also supportive
cons: This pillow is a little bigger and more bulky than other travel pillows available

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, even with a short neck!
customer_reviews.text: Most travel neck pillows make me feel completely overwhelmed, and this is especially great for those with shorter necks. It gives you control and once you get the positioning that you prefer, it is really comfortable and provides the right support in the right places. Also, (and this was a selling point in the beginning,) having used this on several long-haul flights, I loved that after each trip, I could easily unzip the cover and throw it in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: ltny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for stabilizing neck while reading in bed/ cats like it
customer_reviews.text: EDIT:: Buying another one because my cat has laid claim to the first one...when the pillow is curved she sleeps behind it like she would in her round bed...funny!! I bought this pillow to support my neck while reading in bed when laying on my side. It keeps my neck stable and prevents my shoulder from hitching up to reach my ear. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: PiggieD

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Originally I liked this pillow a lot, a year later and it’s not so great. I don’t travel a lot so I haven’t used it more than a handful of times. Today the memory foam cracked in half along the middle. I think it should last more then five uses.
customer_reviews.author: bettyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Hard spine like core makes this pillow extremely uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This product is made of quality materials and looks nice. The surprise factor,that I was unaware of when choosing this item, is that it has an extremely uncomfortable articulating spine like rod inserted into the middle making the pillow very uncomfortable! Rather than dealing with sending it back to the seller, we surgically removed the spine. I now have a nice soft pillow that I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Great little travel pillow/bolster
customer_reviews.text: In it's most basic form, it is a nice travel neck pillow. The memory foam is not too hard or too soft. The best part of course is the ability to bend it to your will. So many different combinations. I actually had a problem with it's snap closure not staying locked so I contacted their customer support. They are awesome and replaced it for me. Super.
customer_reviews.author: K. Y. Tan

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow for my husband who recently had shoulder surgery. He hasn't been able to get comfortable enough to sleep and has had the added bonus of severe neck pain. The first night he used this pillow, he slept straight through and woke up feeling the best he had in weeks. When I asked what he thought, he said the pillow is an "absolute godsend" (and he never says stuff like that!) Its also great for lumbar support. My daughter, who is 8 months pregnant, tried it for her back - now she wants one for herself and one for her husband. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is awesome! It's super soft and squishy not like the other typical pillows. It molds to any shape needed which is nice if you're sitting window seat and want to rest your head against the wall. It really molds to you neck. Good stuff for long flights.
customer_reviews.author: BAABS

customer_reviews.title: Sweet relief
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I often sleep in my trusty recliner, but needed good neck support. This little beauty fits the bill. Haven't had a crick in my neck for the two weeks I've been using. May not sound that impressive, but my nickname had become Quasimodo. No longer. Yeehaw! The Kid rides again!
customer_reviews.author: Book Monster

customer_reviews.title: Worse product I bought this year reward
customer_reviews.text: The bendable rod inside is obvious! It's very uncomfortable no matter how you bend it when you can feel the hard rod jabbing you when trying to use it. Great concept, horrible execution. Back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: The Shopper Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, took this pillow in one trip and the foam inside split allowing the twistable bar inside to push thru and now very uncomfortable to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as advertised
customer_reviews.text: purchased this for 2 long flights of 15 hours each way. On the return trip the neck snap came apart on the plane while I was sleeping. This meant I had no way of securing it to my back pack and I had to carry it outside my pack. The adjustability wasn't that great-it would not stay in place all that well. I am disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: patricia deventer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on a normal human neck
customer_reviews.text: This is an awful design. If the back of your neck is rounded (like most humans) this pillow will not work. It also does not flex like it says. Really wish I had sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Fabric itchy, pillow too hard, can feel bendable metal inside
customer_reviews.text: Found fabric covering pillow very itchy on my neck. I washed the cover assuming the itchiness was sizing from the material and the itchiness gone (but now cannot return it). The pillow itself is hard and not very comfortable on neck. Yet you can still feel the bendable metal inside on your neck. I thought this was a great idea but wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: VikingQueen

customer_reviews.title: Pillow cover is torn.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this item today. When I opened it up, I noticed that the edge is torn. I would like an item that is worth the money i paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Frappe Mocca

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Thought I found solution to my neck problem with this, tried it for an hour and instead of comfort, you feel the wire in the middle. Poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Daddy Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: My father is mostly non-ambulatory. He has a lift chair that he sits and reads most of the day. AND falls alseep in it as well. He was constantly getting a headache from 'crinking' his neck. This pillow is fantastic! As you can see from the listing photos it is very pliable and can be positioned in several ways to accomodate your need. It's firm, but not too much to take away the comfort. The support is perfect! Just what he needed. Highly recommend~!
customer_reviews.author: FlyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love It!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I know when my DD and DH see it they are going to try to steal it from me. I have a Chiari Malformation and wanted something I could use when my head is up against a head rest, like in the car, the recliner, at the dentist, etc. It is comfortable and I love that you can bend it in different directions it works great the way the woman in the picture is using it or even just straight. Do not want to be without this!
customer_reviews.author: dollydanger

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't Stiff Enough
customer_reviews.text: Had two 17 hour international flights recently and purchased this head rest for those flights. I twisted it, bent the ends, kept the snap closed, kept closure to front then to back but every time I fell sleep it was too soft and weight of my head and chin pushed it forward. Gave 3 stars because compared to not having a memory foam pillow, this was a substantial upgrade. But to me it wasn't that comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I fly every week and have tried all the neck pillows! Inflatables, bead filled, memory foam, etc. This is the most comfortable and versatile! Get it now you won't regret it! i use it exactly how she is in the photo to sleep on the plane against the window. it also snaps on to your backpack for when running around at the airport. i travel weekly and do not know what i would do without this. everyone always comments how comfy it looks. also the cover comes off easily to wash it (have washed it over twenty times and its soft as ever)
customer_reviews.author: Apiccoli

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my 6 hour flight recently and boy was it a great buy! I’ve used these neck style pillows for many years with some common set backs such as “doesn’t support the neck right” or is too soft and not firm enough. The inflatable ones are substandard. This one folds over on itself for side sleeping adding extra cushion! It can be manipulated in many ways. The snappy isn’t a great quality I’ll admit but that doesn’t ruin the product. I figure I can attach from Velcro and call it a day. I use it for long commutes and naps in the car now. Great versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Nessa

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Father uses it for support he is bed bound now keeps head in place, and positions where aspirations is lessened. Memory foam is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hamrick

customer_reviews.title: Don’t believe all the good reviews
customer_reviews.text: This item is NOT soft. It’s hard. There is a metal rod in the middle that is hinged and allows for twisting into shapes, which it does not do well. The fabric covering is so over stuffed there is no give. It might be okay for low back support while sitting in a chair or recliner, but it’s sure not comfortable at your neck. It’s hardly comfortable at all. It’s given me more problems with my neck than I had before because it’s so unyielding. It is not softening up with more use, either. Now, I have to purchase something else that IS soft and malleable, and does not put added pressure on the cervical vertebrae.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy

customer_reviews.title: Great support for flying!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy another travel pillow, having already tried at least 5 in the last 5 years. I’m so glad I bought this one!!! It definitely supports my neck without bending my head forward :) I can also bend it for support underneath my chin to prevent the dreaded head drop! I slept 6 hours straight on an international flight!!! It’s also very useful in the car. So far it has been great!!!?
customer_reviews.author: lynne from co

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: I like this, I don't love it, but I want to love it. It is great in that it is completely customizable. It can have so many uses: neck pillow, leg pillow, travel pillow, kid pillow. My biggest issue with it is that I don't think it has enough cushion. I can feel the hard piece in the middle that allows it to be twisted. But having said that, it does have many uses and as long as I'm not using it sleep on every night, I love the concept and I think it is great for traveling in the car!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory A Meaux

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough!
customer_reviews.text: I am a petite woman, and I found the circumference of this pillow too small to be truly comfortable. While sitting in the middle seat on a plane and needing neck support on both sides, the depth of this pillow was lacking. If it were a few inches bigger, I think it would be much more supportive. It was still better than nothing at all. However on my next flight, I sat by the window and used it again. Being able to twist it and have it hold its shape so I could sleep comfortably against the window was very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Cate R

customer_reviews.title: The good: the bendable "bar" inside really is quite strong ...
customer_reviews.text: The good: the bendable "bar" inside really is quite strong - it can nearly hold your head up on it's own. You can bend it into about any position feasible, so that's really nice too. The bad: I wish the memory foam was WAY more dense. To me it didn't really feel like memory foam at all... my head just really sunk into it without much support. Because of this I ended up returning them, but for someone else they might be just right.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: poor quality, arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: When the product arrived and I started to remove the cover to wash it, I saw that the memory foam was already ripped in half. I did not even use it once.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Elkin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Pillow
customer_reviews.text: I recently pierced one of my ears for the first time (3 piercings: rook and 2 helixes). The piercer suggested getting a travel pillow to sleep on so I can sleep on my side with the piercings without laying on them as it would be painful and affect healing. After looking through some options I chose this one because I liked the plush and bendable features. Since receiving it I have been so comfortable and has helped tremendously to sleep at night while the piercings heal. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a travel pillow, neck support, or for the same reason as me!
customer_reviews.author: Audre

customer_reviews.title: too short
customer_reviews.text: Does contort and mostly holds position, but needs 4-6 more inches to support my chin, neck, and head in a comfortable position. I'm 6'4" with a long neck. It did not appear to be supporting the model's chin in the photo, but I was hoping. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Hammerick

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little neck pillow
customer_reviews.text: This neck pillow has really helped me to sleep better. I'm a stomach/side sleeper mostly, and I've been trying to sleep more on my back. The problem is that most pillows tilt me head down, which seems to block up my nasal airway somewhat. I put this pillow in the crux of my neck, which helps to tilt my head back and opens the airways. The fact that you can bend it is really cool, too. I don't know how they could put a substantial bendable rod in there without me feeling it, but it is really indiscernible in use.
customer_reviews.author: Helen C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad neck, back or side sleeper try it!
customer_reviews.text: A pillow is and important and fit must enhance comfort by just the right support. I have cervical ( neck issues) pain. I literally have purchased and tried over 20 pillows. Some were touted as the “only one “ ever need. Please! This little pillow is PERFECT! Shape it anyway you need circumference is not so large it tilts your head forward but still cradles you’re neck. Try this pillow it maybe your ticket to a great nights sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Len1946

customer_reviews.title: Would have been perfect without the bar
customer_reviews.text: Pillow has an internal bar/spine that keeps the pillow twisted or bent at a certain angle. Problem is the bar is hard and makes the pillow hard. Would have been perfect without the bar. Too bad. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: adjustable support
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a 10 day bus tour, sometimes for back support or arm support or neck support. I used it in hotels with poor pillows. I used it on long plane flights to sleep against or help my back. The malleable feature made it easier to carry or store. I could feel the spring if I grasped it firmly but it never intruded on me when I used it. I washed it at home and it came out perfectly clean. I would recommend this to a friend (my wife sometimes used it too).
customer_reviews.author: Sadly wiser

customer_reviews.title: it didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry. I wrote that it's easy to clean because t has a nice washable cover; but it was too hard for me and hurt my neck; I tried it next to my pillow to support my neck when I slept and also around my neck when I leaned back against another kind of pillow to watch tv. also in the car; sadly we had to returni t.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not worth the money. Got a hole on the side after one trip. Wasn’t as supportive as I thought it would be, and was actually quite hard to adjust on the plane.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Beaton

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: The metal bar inside is painful, no way to use them, save your money
customer_reviews.author: VLMagnu

customer_reviews.title: Nice pillow bad odor
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had cervical fusion surgery, so this type of pillow works well for him. HOWEVER this pillow stinks like mildew. My husband had me check it out, and as soon as I sniffed it I started sneezing. We have tried placing in freezer to try to kill the mildew odor. After 36 hours it wasn't as strong, but still had bad odor. We have placed it back in the freezer, hopefully it will kill the odor. Other than the odor, my husband likes the pillow.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bly

customer_reviews.title: With a few tweaks this could be good
customer_reviews.text: Wish this was a bit longer. I’m not a large person and I needed it longer for better support. Material is nice though. Need a redesign!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Veneris

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: great as a back support for the airplane, too heave on the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Bozena

customer_reviews.title: Love it! High quality product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product if only for the fact that it does exactly what it is supposed to do...support whichever appendage or area you need. The fact that it is twistable/bendable to aid in the support you need, especially when you are not in the comforts of home, is a big boon; period! If you have ever felt cramped in an airplane seat and desperate to get some shut eye, riding in a car, or contorting your body into those universally uncomfortable airport seats during a layover...it's wonderful to have a "neck pillow, etc." that can bend to yours needs at the time you need it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Flexible, but wire inside is hard and the pillow will not hold position.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife after her shoulder surgery in an effort to find something that would support her without hurting. The pillow is very flexible and moderately comfortable, but the wire inside that maintains shape is covered with an inner pad that is rather hard. If I had to guess, I would say the wire is coat-hanger-like and the inner pad that covers it is like a small pool noodle. The pillow flexes easily but will not hold a position against a little force or weight. It did not work for my wifes needs.
customer_reviews.author: Hodgepodgerama

customer_reviews.title: loved, but...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this, it was very comfortable and I could use it for multiple things and really get comfortable on the plane, BUT it had a button connector between the two ends and the button was REALLY weak unfortunately. I snapped it to my backpack and must have unsnapped while I walked. So I lost it in the airport...very disappointing! If you do purchase, then you should consider cutting a hole in it to add a clip that will secure it to your bag, otherwise, you'll lose it :(
customer_reviews.author: julian

customer_reviews.title: Carries well and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It works as billed. It took a while to tweak the bends to where I wanted but I don’t fly enough to know intuitively. I like that you can conform it to any seat. Because it bends it doesn’t like to stay in one spot once you get it adjusted but it’s definitely better than most and I’ve tried a few from the turtle to the traditional horseshoe. I’m keeping it as my go to since it has a great balance between comfort and easy of carry. It does fit inside my backpack or clipped to the outside so that is a huge plus. To many of the others are clunky to carry. This is more transportable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Doubtful at first, but --
customer_reviews.text: This weird little thing is great. I initially bought it as a pillow to use as extra cushioning between my neck and shoulder after pacemaker implantation, when I sleep on my side (to prevent pinching at too acute an angle). It works great for that, but since then I've found all sorts of uses -- as a neck pillow, as a body pillow, to elevate limbs, etc. I have not yet traveled with it, but I'm sure it would be good for that; and I cannot compare it to similar items. But this one is going on my gift list for others for sure! Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: L. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this for a 14 hour flight to Korea. I was very disappointed when I left it behind on the plane as it was the most comfortable "neck pillow" I have owned. What I liked most about it is the flexibility of use. I was able to twist it to sleep against the window, use it to protect my back from getting jabbed by the seat belts when I slept across a few seats and it held my neck securely when used as a neck pillow. I will be purchasing another one. Also the price was very good at $12.
customer_reviews.author: K. ONeal

customer_reviews.title: Helps me sleep 🛏 😴 💤 on my back!!!
customer_reviews.text: InLove 💕 this little pillow! I’m a side sleeper trying to train myself to sleep 💤 on my back and this is the best I’ve found ! Even if I turn to the side, my face stays off the pillow keeping it from scrunching all up causing wrinkles !
customer_reviews.author: Patti16

customer_reviews.title: Firm and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my surgery recovery. I assumed it would be holding my neck up at night while I was all propped up, but I've actually been using it at my lower back and sometimes against my side to prop up my arm. It's nice that it's versatile, it feels nice and soft but firm enough to hold shape. No weird warehouse smell at delivery either. Overall, I think it's been a good buy that will be useful for more after I'm done recovering from surgery. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: cbeach710

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this pillow for three months now and I love it. Ive been battling a sprained neck for a while now and this pillow has been good support for it. I usually sleep with it at this point. I'm always careful bending it for fear it will break but it's been holding up well. It does squeek when I bend it but so what? I've tried a different brand but this one has thicker, softer foam. Update: After 9 months of every day use the zipper broke off of the pillow case and I notified their customer support about it. They responded quickly and sent me a new case free of charge. 6 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Long trip lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to Scotland earlier this year. It was absolutely perfect on the plane, a 12-hour bus tour, and my friend's loveseat I crashed on. The bendability (is that a word?) puts it far above any other travel pillow I've used. It's easy to manipulate but still holds its shape pretty well once you settle on the right position. It's also easy to cram into a backpack. The cover is soft, and the padding is nice, too. I think it's memory foam. Great purchase for anybody who travels a lot or who even have a long bus/train commute or something.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I've had TONS of travel pillows. This is my favorite. It's flexible and you can adjust it no matter how you lay or how tall you are. I'm small and a lot of pillows are way to tall for me. This one you can use it if you're in a middle seat or by the window, as you can straighten it out or make it l-shaped to help support your neck as you lean up against the window. It's worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Happy With My Pillow
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am happy with my purchase, which arrived promptly, securely packaged. I don't travel much anymore, and was looking for support for my neck and body, especially when sleeping. For that, this product is a good fit. The material is soft and very comfortable. The pillow is slightly stiff for my personal taste, but not so much as to be a problem. I expect it to soften with use. Everyone has their own preference on this, so I didn't take off any points for this. Overall, I would recommend this pillow, unless you really want a squishy pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Palace

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a pillow to take and use during dialysis, did not like the regular neck pillows, makes me feel like I'm being choked. Saw the Twist Memory Foam pillow and thought I would give it a try. LOVE IT! So comfortable you can adjust it however you like, and it is not that hard memory foam either. LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.author: S. M.

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as stated & saved my neck from pain after surgery!!
customer_reviews.text: I do like this product. However, the bar inside to bend it into position is quite large, making it a bit firmer and heavier than I thought it would be. I had to sleep in a recliner for 3 months after a surgery and would have been miserable without this, as it's easy to bend and move into different shapes to totally save you so much neck pain if you're confined too. It does work as they state it does 100% of the time. The cover unzips to wash as well.
customer_reviews.author: shellyscorpio

customer_reviews.title: Good support but Too bulky
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is good in the sense that it does what it advertises - however I found it way too bulky to haul around for a month in Europe. It was helpful for extra support in hostel bunk beds but it got in the way while trying to organize my stuff on the trains, planes and busses. My sister referred to it as one of the life jackets from the titanic. I’ve ordered the neck-wrap support to use on my next trip. Much slimmer design, and easier to pack!
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Buy Pillows in Person
customer_reviews.text: I’m returning this. It doesn’t twist as easily as it looks and is thin. You can feel a bar inside!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: I have neck issues and I sleep on this every night
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty bad neck problems. Started using a rolled up bath towel under my neck as a pillow at night. If I rolled over on my side, I'd fold the towel into a teardrop shape. This pillow is a softer version of what I was already doing, and really holds its shape. I wish it was a tiny bit more firm, but overall it's great.
customer_reviews.author: dmoz

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable, and the adjustment allows for multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: This is a great neck pillow, we used it on a recent trip, and it worked great. Since it is adjustable you can move it around to accommodate different positions while traveling, or support your head at different angles. We lent it out to some friends traveling last week, and they raved about it to us upon their return. My only issue is when adjusting the pillow, it makes some squeaking/creaking noises from the internals. Not sure if this will be a durability issue or if that is just how it works.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Easy to Shape
customer_reviews.text: Its comfortable and easy to shape into what feels most comfortable. The casing is removable so that you can wash it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Concepcion

customer_reviews.title: Really hard inner core
customer_reviews.text: There wasnt anything mentioned that the inner core is bigger than expected. The outer pillow is great until your head sinks further into the pillow, the core is hard. I could not rest with this pillow no matter how many ways i twistied the pillow to bypass inner core. Being a able to twist the pillow in any direction is great, but if you want comfort, skip this pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Kythemom

customer_reviews.title: My husband knows me all too well...
customer_reviews.text: My husband knows me all too well, and for Christmas he bought me this neck pillow. I'm constantly falling asleep when we're driving in the car (even on short 20 minute drives) and he bought this for me to use during these occasions. Let me tell you, this is the most practical gift I've had in a long time and I can't believe I've gone so long without it! I can't say enough about how comfortable it is. I'm not kidding when I say that I fall asleep in moments when I use this. I highly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: SmantiJork

customer_reviews.title: HURTS! Stiff neck galore
customer_reviews.text: I spent an extra $200 to get the knows out of my neck. It’s a Phillies encasing a HARD BENDABLE BAND. Stick to memory foam.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get mine to work right. Took it on a trip, practiced on the coach and car beforehand and nothing worked. As other reviewers state, there's a rod inside to make it twistable, but it just makes the whole thing uncomfortable. Plus, no matter what position I put it in, it wasn't comfortable for me. Then I was just annoyed that I had to carry a stupid, weird looking pillow around with me that had no use.
customer_reviews.author: Missy Malick

customer_reviews.title: Unique and perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is just such a cool pillow. I sleep with it every night. I only wish I could get additional covers for it. If you lay on your back and put this under your neck, you will get such a perfectly wonderful spinal stretch. All your vertebrae will be in the right place.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: doesn't bend
customer_reviews.text: This product does not hold it's shape when twisted. I twist it into a position as shown and it stretches out straight within a few seconds. It really only has two shapes--a long tube or a horseshoe if the snap is closed. It was a big disappointment on my first flight. I tried it again a few weeks ago and had the same experience. Bad purchase. I should have returned it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit!
customer_reviews.text: My mom is in a Geri chair in the Nursing Home a big part of the day. When we would go to visit, she would be slouched over and just looked very uncomfortable. We tried stuffing pillows, cushions, blankets, even towels in the sides of her chair to keep her from leaning but nothing worked. I bought these Twist Memory Foam Pillows and they work perfect! They twist to fit wherever we need them to fit and they're also substantial enough to keep her in place, but still cushiony and comfortable for her. We've only had them a short while, but we already know this will be what we continue to use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
